title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 October 2016 - XWiki

15:44 <vmassol> has quit  
15:46 <msmeria> has quit  
15:48 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:48 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
15:58 <barretto> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <barretto> guys, how can I have multiples wikis in my XWiki instance. How can I set one of them as the default one? I mean, when someone opens up my url this will be the wiki presented  
15:59 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
16:01 <gdelhumeau> you cannot chose which one is the default one  
16:01 <gdelhumeau> the default is the "main" wiki, that we also call the "home"  
16:04 <tmortagne> barretto: each wiki can have it's own domain name so you can assign "www.mydomain.com" alias to whatever wiki you want  
16:04 <tmortagne> you set it in the wiki descriptor (look at the wiki index)  
16:04 <tmortagne> but you also need to configure your DNS on your side  
16:05 <barretto> well, the main problem is that after a clean install of an xwiki (without flavor extension) the Wiki Application extension, which should enable this menu (http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Wiki+Application/add-wiki.png) doesn't works at the "main" wiki. I have absolutely no problem on using the main one, but I need to be able to provide this menu to my wiki users...  
16:06 <barretto> in fact I'd rather use the main one  
16:07 <barretto> when I create a new wiki, the menu appears and works just fine  
16:08 <barretto> so, if it works properly at the main wiki, I wont need to create a second wiki at all  
16:21 <barretto> Just to clearify i've installed these extensions: Extension Manager (manually), Administration Application/Wiki Application (via Extension Manager)  
16:23 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
16:25 <msmeria> has quit  
16:32 <Slashman> has quit  
16:37 <hakin> has joined #xwiki  
16:40 <gdelhumeau> does xwiki:WikiManager.CreateWiki exist?  
16:41 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: not sure what is the quesiton  
16:41 <vmassol> this page exists for sure  
16:41 <vmassol> see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/044ec6f97df64f9261a0db66185f644721747fc8/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-wiki/xwiki-platform-wiki-ui/xwiki-platform-wiki-ui-mainwiki/src/main/resources/WikiManager/CreateWiki.xml#L23-L23  
16:41 <gdelhumeau> my question was for barretto  
16:41 <vmassol> (ah sorry I guess there was a question while I was disconnected :))  
16:44 <barretto> yes it exists  
16:44 <barretto> no problem, I'll rephrase my question @vmassol  
16:46 <barretto> after a clean install of an xwiki instance (without flavor extension) I've installed the following extensions: Extension Manager (manually), Administration Application/Wiki Application (via Extension Manager). the Wiki Application extension, which should enable this menu (http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Wiki+Application/add-wiki.png) doesn't works at the "main" wiki.  
16:46 <barretto> When I create a new wiki, it works just fine and menu is properly provided  
16:47 <barretto> so, I have no problem using the main wiki as long as it properly provides the wiki application menu. I was thinking about using a new wiki and setting it as default, but as gdelhumeau stated it is not possible to override the "main" wiki  
16:52 <barretto> this is how the top right menu appears at the "main" wiki  
16:52 <barretto> http://imgur.com/a/ITX3A  
16:58 <gdelhumeau> so the problem is that it's written "create wiki" instead of "+ wiki"?  
17:07 <barretto> no, the problem is that the other options are missing... like  
17:08 <barretto> http://imgur.com/a/2vDBd  
17:13 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
17:32 <ClemensR> looks like the navigation should look like when you are in a sub wiki; there one has the "Delete Wiki" option, but no "Add wiki" one  
17:49 <gdelhumeau> barretto: I see  
17:49 <gdelhumeau> you need the user application too  
17:50 <gdelhumeau> "User Directory Application"  
17:50 <gdelhumeau> and the Index Application  
17:51 <gdelhumeau> basically you need to install all extensions that are normally bundled with the default flavor  
17:51 <gdelhumeau> you might as well install the flavor  
18:06 <barretto> gdelhumeau: ok, I'll install those extensions. do you think that install flavor and delete all pages is better than starting with a clean one and install extensions?  
18:06 <gdelhumeau> you don't need to delete all pages  
18:06 <gdelhumeau> to install the flavor  
18:09 <vmassol> has quit  
18:09 <barretto> i mean, after installing the flavor  
18:11 <barretto> like blog, sandbox, etc..  
18:11 <barretto> that's why I'm trying a clean install  
18:12 <barretto> I want all functionality but no content  
18:15 <barretto> gdelhumeau: and for the User Directory Application (http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/User+Directory+Application) I can't find it in the Ext. Manager nor any .xar download. I presume it is installed by default, right?  
18:16 <barretto> sorry, I've found it under "local extensions" in the EM  
18:18 <gdelhumeau> then it was already installed I suppose  
18:19 <gdelhumeau> according to your needs, it seems better to do as you started  
18:19 <gdelhumeau> starting from nothing, and install only apps that you need  
18:19 <gdelhumeau> but notice that subwikis are created with the default flavor for subwikis  
18:23 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
18:23 <barretto> yes, now it makes sense why sub-wikis had a fully working top right menu while main wiki didnt  
18:43 <gdelhumeau> barretto: yep  
18:44 <tillo> has quit  
18:46 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:51 <barretto> gdelhumeau: thanks! i'll get back soon with other questions  (mainly about URL rewrite and how-to disable RPC API)  
18:52 <tillo> has joined #xwiki
